intro: Dichapetalum thonneri var. longistipulatum, commonly known as the long-stippled dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. Its unique morphological features, including elongated stipules, set it apart from other varieties within the species. This plant is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in cooler, well-drained conditions.
